title: Why is it important to study sociology? Is sociology considered the mother of social science disciplines? How is sociology interrelated to other social science disciplines? - Quora

response.answer_text: Why is it important to study sociology? Is sociology considered the mother of social science disciplines? How is sociology interrelated to other social science disciplines? As a practicing Sociologist, my answer is very biased. How is sociology interrelated to other social science disciplines?Sociology was derived from Anthropology which is as study of humans, human behavior and societies in the past and present, whereas Sociology is the study of the development, structure, and functioning of human society. Close, but different concentrations. My minor was in Cultural Anthropology. My specific area of study and practice is concentrated on the interaction of cultures within society - specifically the array of original First Nations cultures/societies as they interact with the dominant European- based society. Why is Sociology important?It is my firm belief that by having a better understanding of people and their cultural structures and sub-structures (society) in any specific geographical location, we can reduce or eliminate inter-cultural / inter-societal friction (AKA: bigotry / prejudice, etc.).Key to this practice is “Cultural Safety and Humility” - the internal acceptance that you don’t know what you don’t know, leading to a curiosity of how to better understand another culture (at the heart of it is simply by asking “is this OK with you”) in your personal, business, social interactions. If you wan more information on Cultural Safety, check out this information from NAHO https://www.saintelizabeth.com/getmedia/970b1d43-688c-4bb7-9732-09cc8d1d1716/Cultural-Safety-Fact-Sheet.pdf.aspx?ext=.pdf

the importance of sociology is numerous. the following are the importance of sociology. Sociology helps us with an understanding of how social forces shape individual attitude and behavioursociology shows us how societies are developed and maintainedsociology helps us to appreciate the diversity that exists in the human populationsociology helps us to understand ourselves and otherssociology adds value to our lives by empowering us to make well thought out decisions.sociology is the queen mother of social sciences because it cuts across all disciplines.
